On February 13th Mrs. Walsh and the 6th grade student council went to Kent Social Services and worked with Marquice Seward stocking shelves, making cold packs of meat, stocking the refrigerators, and serving lunch to those in need.

These students learned what happens to the food that Kent City Schools collects and donates to Kent Social Services. Marquice gave the students a tour of the facility from the minute people sign in, to where they store can food, freezer food, baby diapers, socks, toiletries and the kitchen where they prepare hot meals.

Thank you, Marquice, for taking the time to ensure that our students had a very educational experience!

Often the pantry gets low on supplies from February to July. The facility accepts food donations all year long. #KentRiderPride
